messages.content: What is the "cross-platform" analog of CUDA and ROCm?

A cross-platform analog of CUDA and ROCm would be OpenCL. It is an open standard for parallel programming across multiple platforms, including CPUs, GPUs, and other accelerators. It supports the development of high-performance applications that run efficiently on a variety of hardware platforms.

OpenCL has a number of benefits that make it a good choice for cross-platform development:

1.  Wide hardware support: OpenCL is supported by a wide range of hardware vendors, including Intel, AMD, NVIDIA, and others. This means that you can develop a single application that can run on different hardware platforms, reducing the need for platform-specific code.

2.  Separation of concerns: OpenCL allows you to separate the compute-intensive parts of your application from the rest of the code. This makes it easier to optimize the performance of your application and to port it to different platforms.

3.  Portability: OpenCL is designed to be portable, which means that you can write your code once and run it on different platforms without significant changes. This makes it easier to deploy your application and to maintain it over time.

OpenCL is a powerful tool for cross-platform development, and it has been used in a wide range of applications, including machine learning, scientific computing, and graphics.
How do I become a Vtuber?

The process of becoming a virtual YouTuber (Vtuber) involves several steps:

Create a virtual avatar: The first step is to create a virtual avatar that will represent you. This can be done using 3D modeling software or by using a pre-made avatar.

Choose a niche: Determine what type of content you want to create. Some popular Vtuber genres include gaming, fashion, beauty, and lifestyle.

Set up a YouTube channel: Create a YouTube channel and set it up to host your Vtuber content. Make sure to choose a username and channel name that are easy to remember and reflect your brand.

Record your content: Once you have your avatar and channel set up, you can start recording your Vtuber content. You can use a green screen or virtual backgrounds to create your virtual environment.

Edit and upload your videos: Use video editing software to edit your videos and add any special effects or animations. Once you're done, upload them to your YouTube channel.

Build an audience: Finally, start promoting your channel and building an audience. You can do this by interacting with other Vtubers, participating in online communities, and engaging with your subscribers.

Becoming a Vtuber requires creativity, technical skills, and a willingness to learn. But with hard work and dedication, you can build a following and make your mark in the virtual world.
What guidelines should be obliged for a discord server to become partnered?

Discord has a set of guidelines for servers to become partnered. These guidelines include:

Must have 25,000+ members.
Must have an active and unique community.
Must not violate Discord's Terms of Service.
Must not promote harmful or illegal activities.
Must not use Discord's brand or logos without permission.
Must not engage in harassment or bullying behavior.
Must not use automated bots or other content that violates Discord's bot policies.

Servers that meet these guidelines can apply for partnership by filling out an application form on the Discord Partner Program website.

Note that these guidelines may change over time, and Discord reserves the right to approve or deny partnership applications at its discretion.
